STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
March 31, 2025
Nichole Powell
Catholic Charities Ingham, Eaton, Clinton
2800 W. Willow St.
Lansing, MI, 48917-1833
RE: License#: CB330201019
Dear Ms. Powell:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 3/20/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12209 Orientation and training
(1) An agency shall ensure and document all the
following:
(a) That each social service worker and each social
service supervisor receives not less than 16 hours of
orientation after initial appointment and before
assumption of assigned duties.
One of one new employee files did not have orientation completed prior to
assuming duties.
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records
(3) The personnel record must contain both of the
following:
(a) A written evaluation of a staff member's
performance within a probationary period or not later
than 6 months after the staff member assumes his or
her current responsibilities. After the initial evaluation, a
written evaluation must be conducted every 12 months.
Two of three employee files did not have an annual performance evaluation.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
3/11/2024 Interim, CAP approved 4/2/24

CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
(5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or parents
and the foster parents in the development of service
plans to enable the parent or parents and foster
parents to understand the plan for the child and the
parents' and the foster parent's role in assisting the
agency in carrying out the plan. An agency shall give a
copy to and review the parent-agency treatment plan
with the parent or parents and foster parents. The
agency must inform the parent or parents and foster
parent that the information in the parent-agency
treatment plan and any other information about the
child and the child's family is confidential.
Two of three foster care case files held treatment plans that did not have
signatures from the parent or foster parent to indicate they reviewed and received
a copy of the report.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
3/11/2024 Interim, CAP approved 4/2/24
CPA Rule 400.12421 Visitation and family time; in person contact
(2) An agency social service worker shall visit the foster
child, and the foster parent, if applicable, in the child's
placement at least once every month.
One of three foster care files did not have a monthly home visit completed in
August 2024.
CPA Rule 400.12421 Visitation and family time; in person contact
(3) An agency shall facilitate in-person contact between
parents and children except where parental rights have
been terminated or when there is a court determination
that visits are detrimental to the child.
One of three foster care files did not have parenting time documented for July
2024.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Adoptive Family Evaluation: The agency was advised that when an adoption
evaluation is completed without all of the required information, in order to
meet the 90-day timeframe, the agency must include all known information in

the report and outline additional items that are still needed before a
recommendation can be made.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment In Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The 4/2/2024 CAP was the result of the 3/11/2024 interim inspection. In the 2024
inspection, the agency was cited regarding placement information, adoptive family
evaluations, staff performance evaluations, and parent agency treatment plan
(PATP) signatures. The agency reported partial compliance with the CAP as they
had improvement regarding placement information and timeliness of adoptive
family evaluations. However, during the 2025 review there were two repeat
violations regarding staff performance evaluations and PATP signatures. These
repeat violations will need to be addressed in a new CAP.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator assessment, dated 3/9/25, was reviewed and discussed
on-site. The chief administrator reported implementation of the 2024 CAP to
address previous violations. Implementation included review of the CAP with staff
monthly for the first three months, then quarterly review thereafter. During that
time, there were some staffing changes, which presented challenges. However,
the chief administrator indicated significant progress was made. The agency
resumed annual evaluations and implemented self-evaluations and supervisor
evaluations to be completed by May 2024. The agency reported that increased
tracking and email reminders improved compliance regarding PATP signatures.
While there was improvement over the past year, the agency continues to work
toward greater compliance in both of these areas. The agency reported calendar
invites, notifications, and increased communication assisted with improvement in
timely completion of adoption assessments and foster parent information provided
at placement. There were no repeat violations in these areas. The chief
administrator assessment indicated there were two children with unplanned moves
in 2024. The two siblings had significant, violent, and aggressive behavior towards

others, as well as self-harm due to complex trauma and re-entry into foster care.
The placement could not be maintained due to systemic difficulty accessing
adequate behavioral health supports between two counties. The agency will
continue to work with MDHHS and community partners to address this need.
Financial Overview
The agency’s 2024 financial audit and 2025 budget were reviewed. No financial
concerns were noted.
Staff Interviews
Three staff were interviewed on-site. Staff reported they have great co-workers
and supportive supervisors. Staff indicated they are provided with useful training
opportunities and information to assist and support them in their positions. No
concerns or areas in need of improvement were identified.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency continues to be located in the same building as the 2024 review. The
building has ample space for staff to work and securely store files. The building
has space for clients to have meetings and visitation as needed.
VII. AGENCY ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
_ ____________March 27, 2025________________________
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
March 27, 2025
